alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:59AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Laurel, west central Bell, western Knox, southeastern Pulaski, eastern McCreary and Whitley Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 559 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huxley, or 14 miles north of Whitley City, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cumberland Falls S.P., Honeybee, Bark Camp, Beulah Heights and Grove around 610 AM EDT. Youngs Creek and Deering around 615 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Krupp, Clio, Walden, Redbird, Bounty, Duckrun, Goldbug, Williamsburg, Bon, Wofford, Hollyhill, Emlyn, Jellico Creek, Yaden, Suttons Mill, Julip, Mountain Ash, Pleasant View, Ayers, Zion Hill, Dixie, Verne, Lucky, Saxton, Packard, Polly Camp, Nevisdale and Gatliff. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 3 and 34. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County near mile marker 12, and between mile markers 15 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 2, and between mile markers 7 and 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Whitley
